p: Additionally, three known limonoids; azadirone ( 153), 12α-acetoxy-7-deacetylazadirone ( 154), mzikonone ( 155), 11- epi-toonacilin ( 156) and azadironolide ( 157), which were isolated from the stem bark of Turraea nilotica (Meliaceae), all showed potent antiplasmodial activity against the D6 and W2 strains with IC 50 values ranged from 2.4 to 36.6 µM and from 1.1 to 40.5 µM, respectively [ 95].
